column4: I'll refrase. I just installed virtualbox 3.04 on my 4-core AMD running ubuntu jaunty. When I start virtualbox from the applications menue _> system, the first screen comes up and then the whole system freezes completely. I can reach the system from another computer with SSH but I cannot revive it. Anybody has ideas?
If you can access the machine do a 'sudo killall gdm' first.
thanks. I did from a terminal /etc/init.d/gdm stop ( I had root rights) but nothing happened except it did tell me gdm wsa stoppend but that was not true.
np
what do you mean??
nothing... sorry np means no problem... ;)
minimec; OK. I have virtualbox running on another system without any problem but that's an AMD 64-bit 3000+ running hardy and a little bit too slow for what I want to do.
I have a AMD X2 5000+ running with Virtualbox. I did not change any defaults.
I have restarted the whole system Could it be the fact that I use a KVM-switch to toggle between 2 systems?
I don't think so.
storm: When I star vortualbox (AMD 4-core jaunty) the whole system freezes. No keyboard activity is possible. Only the mouse-pointer can be moved.
yes I thought so but it is a major problem as I want to use the system to run sevral programs on a.o. Windows (yes I know!!!) but some programs are only written for that OS.
storm: any ideas?
So your Virtualbox image freezes, when you start it with the configuration tool?
worse: I start simply from the Application Menu -> System Tools -> SUn Virtual Box.
Try to start it from a console once. That is strange... Maybe you get an error message. Did you search the net for that strange behaviour?
you mean a terminal in gnome or from F1?

You have to do it inside gnome. Well you risk another freeze, but maybe you get some error codes. Also check if there is some kind of log file in /home/<yourname>/.VirtualBox I don't know if VirtualBox does create some error logs.
no log but a Directory .Virtualbox with no logfile. I go and look in /var/,og. One moment...
I dont see any logfile related to Virtualbox but I haven't looked inside the files. I can try a grep in the directory.
I don't see a reason for VirtualBox to freeze at start... sorry.
